DOCNAME: CASE OF TAHSIN ACAR v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Government’s request to strike the application out of the list rejected
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in GPE ( GPE ) . A summary of the facts as submitted by the parties in the proceedings before the ORG is set out below .

CARDINAL . The applicant ’s brother PERSON was a farmer living in GPE , a village in the Bismil district in south - east GPE . On DATE , while PERSON was working in a cotton field near PERSON , a white or grey ORG car without any registration plates stopped . CARDINAL armed men in plain clothes – claiming to be police officers – got out of the car and asked PERSON to accompany them in order to help them find a field . When PERSON refused to get into the car , the CARDINAL men threatened him with their weapons . They then took his identity card , tied his hands , blindfolded him , punched him in the head and stomach , forced him into their car and drove off .

CARDINAL . The scene was witnessed by PERSON son PERSON , and PERSON , another farmer . After the car had driven off , PERSON ran to his home and told his mother PERSON what had happened , and she in turn informed the village headman . PERSON , PERSON daughter , had seen her father in the back seat of a “ grey - coloured ” car passing through the village while she and a neighbour were washing clothes in a stream . Another villager had allegedly seen PERSON being taken to the riverbank , where CARDINAL other people had been waiting in another car . PERSON hands and feet had been tied , he had been blindfolded and his mouth had been taped . The CARDINAL cars had reportedly driven off in the direction of ORG . Nothing has been heard from PERSON since .

CARDINAL . PERSON family filed a series of petitions and complaints about his disappearance with the authorities , including the Deputy Governor and the Bismil gendarmerie , in order to find out where and why he was being detained .

CARDINAL . On or DATE PERSON sister PERSON personally handed a written petition about her brother ’s disappearance to the Deputy Governor of ORG . After reading the petition and speaking to PERSON , a non - commissioned officer of the gendarmerie , the Deputy Governor told her that PERSON was in the hands of the State and that there was nothing she could do for the time being .

CARDINAL . When leaving the Deputy Governor ’s office , PERSON was approached by a police officer , PERSON , who volunteered to make enquiries about her brother with a friend in the “ torture place ” of the ORG gendarmerie station . This police officer rang PERSON DATE and told her that he had seen PERSON at the Bismil gendarmerie command and that he could bring him some clothes and cigarettes . After PERSON had fetched some clothes , the police officer told her that he would take these to her brother in CARDINAL or CARDINAL days’ time . On DATE the police officer called PERSON again and told her that her brother had been taken away from the ORG gendarmerie command and that he did not know where to .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON , PERSON mother , filed a petition with the ORG public prosecutor requesting an investigation of her son ’s disappearance .

CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the public prosecutor requested information from the ORG gendarmerie commander about the case . On DATE the public prosecutor took statements from Hüsna , NORP and PERSON , and the farmer PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON asked the Bismil Chief Public Prosecutor for information about the progress of the investigation , but she received no reply .
CARDINAL . In his letters of CARDINAL DATE and DATE , the applicant asked the public prosecutor at ORG to investigate the whereabouts of his brother PERSON . These letters remained unanswered .
CARDINAL . NORP By letters of CARDINAL DATE and CARDINAL DATE the ORG public prosecutor asked the ORG gendarmerie commander for information about the case .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant requested the Bismil Chief Public Prosecutor for information about the case of PERSON and accused the gendarmes GPE and PERSON and the village guard PERSON of being responsible for his brother ’s abduction .

CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE the applicant sent letters to the Minister for Human Rights and the Minister of ORG , seeking information about his brother ’s whereabouts and condition . On DATE the Minister for Human Rights informed the applicant that his petition had been transmitted to the office of the ORG Governor . In his reply of CARDINAL DATE the applicant requested the Minister for Human Rights to ensure his brother ’s safety and to take urgent action .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor informed the Minister of ORG that PERSON had been abducted by CARDINAL armed men whose identities had not yet been established .
CARDINAL . On DATE gendarmes took further statements from Hüsna , NORP and PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was contacted by an unknown person who asked for MONEY in return for his brother ’s release . The applicant was told that his brother would be interrogated at the ORG gendarmerie command and that he would be able to meet him within DATE . On DATE PERSON family were contacted by a person called PERSON , who informed them that PERSON had been detained in Bolu and subsequently at a military base . He was alive and was working as an agent for the authorities . In order to have him released , the family would have to comply with the conditions of ORG , namely to keep secret the names of those who had abducted him , as well as the place where and the persons by whom he had been detained . The family refused to accept these demands .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON gave a statement to the ORG gendarmerie command to the effect that , in her opinion , the gendarmes NORP and PERSON and the village guard PERSON were responsible for her brother ’s abduction .
CARDINAL . On DATE the home of PERSON was raided by officers of ORG , who threatened her with death and attempted to abduct her CARDINAL-year - old son .

CARDINAL . The applicant was informed in DATE by the ORG general gendarmerie command that his brother had not been apprehended by the gendarmerie but had been abducted by CARDINAL unidentified civilians who claimed to be policemen .

CARDINAL . The applicant also filed a petition about his brother ’s disappearance with ORG of ORG . On DATE , in reply to a request for information , the office of the ORG Governor informed ORG that the case had been investigated , that the CARDINAL gendarmes whose names had been given by the applicant and his sister had not apprehended PERSON , that he had been abducted by CARDINAL unidentified individuals and that the investigation of the case by the ORG public prosecutor was ongoing . This information was transmitted by ORG to the applicant on DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON asked the Bismil public prosecutor for information about the investigation .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor issued a decision of non - jurisdiction ( görevsizlik kararı ) and transmitted the investigation opened in respect of the gendarmes NORP and PERSON and the village guard PERSON to ORG ( PERSON ) for further proceedings under LAW ( Memurin Muhakematı GPE ) .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON requested the ORG Governor to open an investigation into PERSON disappearance . On DATE the applicant wrote a letter to the President of GPE and filed a further petition with ORG . On DATE PERSON wrote a letter to the President of GPE and to the Minister of the Interior , asking them to investigate the disappearance of her son PERSON . Both petitions were transmitted to the office of the Batman Governor .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG Governor informed PERSON in response to her petition of CARDINAL DATE that an investigation into the matter had been carried out by the Bismil Chief Public Prosecutor and that those responsible for the abduction of her brother had remained unidentified .
CARDINAL . In a decision of DATE ORG decided , on the ground that there was insufficient evidence , not to take any proceedings against the CARDINAL gendarmes and the village guard .

CARDINAL . On DATE at TIME , PERSON and Hüsna and PERSON watched a news broadcast on the ORG television channel . The newsreader announced that CARDINAL persons had been apprehended in GPE , CARDINAL of whom was named PERSON . Pictures of the apprehended men were shown and all CARDINAL of them recognised PERSON . The QUANTITY women continued to watch the television news TIME and saw him again on DATE during the TIME television news broadcast .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON and Hüsna and PERSON informed the ORG public prosecutor in person of what they had seen . The public prosecutor telephoned the office of the ORG public prosecutor and told the women afterwards that CARDINAL persons by the name of PERSON had been apprehended , but that , apart from the name , the particulars of the CARDINAL men did not match those of their relative .

CARDINAL . DATE the ORG public prosecutor informed PERSON that her brother had in fact been apprehended , that he was being held in prison in GPE , and that he would be released after having given a statement .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON told the ORG public prosecutor of her sighting of her brother on television and asked the public prosecutor for information about his fate . The public prosecutor referred her to the PERSON police station , from where she was referred to the police headquarters for verification of the police computer records . There she was told that she would be informed about her brother and was asked to leave . She has subsequently received no further information from the police headquarters .

CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON made a similar request to the office of the ORG Governor , and was again referred to the PERSON police station , which directed her to the Anti - Terrorism Branch , where a police officer took a statement from her and recorded her particulars . After TIME , GPE was told that her brother had not agreed to see his family . When she refused to accept this answer and insisted on seeing him , she was asked to leave . She was informed DATE that her brother was not in fact at the Anti - Terrorism Branch . She was subsequently told to go to the prison in GPE . When she and PERSON went to the prison , they were shown a person who was not PERSON .

CARDINAL . On DATE CARDINAL officers of the Anti - Terrorism Branch came to the home of PERSON and asked her for a copy of her family ’s entry in the population register . She was told that they were looking for PERSON everywhere in GPE and that he had not been found to be dead .

CARDINAL . According to a decision of non - jurisdiction issued on DATE by ORG , the person placed in pre - trial detention in GPE was a PERSON whose year of birth and whose parents did not match the particulars of the applicant ’s brother .
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON filed a petition with the ORG public prosecutor seeking an investigation into the sighting of her brother PERSON during the television news broadcast .
CARDINAL . On CARDINAL DATE ORG issued a decision not to open an investigation ( tapiksizlik kararı ) on the basis of the petition of CARDINAL DATE . That decision reads as follows :

“ The complainant stated in her petition that her brother had disappeared DATE and that nothing had been heard from him since , that she recognised CARDINAL of the persons shown on a news programme in DATE about persons apprehended during operations conducted against the terror organisation ORG , that this person ’s name was the same as her brother ’s name , and that she wished to be given the opportunity to watch a video recording [ of the news broadcast ] so that she could identify her brother .

it has been stated in ORG decision of non - jurisdiction dated DATE that the person detained in the province of GPE – a PERSON , born in DATE and the son of GPE and DATE is not the complainant ’s brother , and it appears from the above decision of non - jurisdiction and from the birth records that the person detained in GPE , who was put on trial by ORG of ORG , is not the complainant ’s brother .
It is therefore concluded , in accordance with LAW and subject to the right of appeal , that there is no basis for pursuing the matter ... ”

CARDINAL . Later in DATE PERSON spoke with a prison officer in ORG . The officer confirmed that he had seen PERSON when he and CARDINAL or CARDINAL others had been apprehended and taken to ORG . According to PERSON , the officer ’s description of PERSON corresponded to her brother ’s appearance .

DATE . On DATE the applicant ’s mother filed a petition with the ORG public prosecutor ’s office requesting an investigation into the whereabouts of her son PERSON , who had been kidnapped by CARDINAL men .

CARDINAL . NORP The public prosecutor opened an investigation , in the course of which statements were taken from Hüsna and PERSON and from the QUANTITY eyewitnesses of the events , PERSON and PERSON .
CARDINAL . PERSON statement of DATE to the public prosecutor , which was read out to him before he signed it , reads :

“ On DATE of the incident , my father and I were working in the field . When we went to sit under a tree to have lunch , PERSON , who was working in the field , joined us . There was a QUANTITY distance between my father and me . At this point , a grey - coloured taxi with no number plates came and stopped near my father . The persons in the car spoke with my father . I saw them take the identity cards of my father and of the person called LOC and then return ORG identity card , and I saw my father get into the taxi . This taxi immediately headed towards the village of PERSON . Later , I went home and informed my mother . As I was far away , I was unable to recognise these people , but I heard that they were speaking NORP . These people were wearing hats and glasses . That is all I know and what I have witnessed . ”
CARDINAL . PERSON statement of DATE to the public prosecutor , which was read out to him before he signed it , reads :

“ On DATE of the incident , while PERSON and I were having lunch in the field below the village of PERSON , a ORG model grey taxi without number plates approached us . The persons in the car asked us to hand over our identity cards . When we refused , they forced us by saying that they were the police and that we were therefore obliged to hand over our identity cards . The persons who asked for our cards had a western accent . Both of them were CARDINAL or DATE . CARDINAL of them was wearing glasses . They did not give back PERSON identity card . They said that ‘ PERSON will show us someone ’s field and then we will send him back’ . That is all I know and what I have witnessed in relation to the incident . ”
CARDINAL . On DATE PERSON filed another petition with the Bismil public prosecutor .
CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor requested the ORG gendarmerie command to investigate whether or not PERSON had been kidnapped .

CARDINAL . On DATE gendarmes took statements from Hüsna , NORP and PERSON and from PERSON . On the basis of the applicant ’s allegation that PERSON had been taken away by CARDINAL officers of the ORG gendarmerie and a local village guard , PERSON was asked whether the persons whom he had seen worked at the ORG gendarmerie command . He replied :

“ Those persons were not persons working at the ORG gendarmerie command . As I have already stated above , I have not seen these persons before . Moreover , PERSON did not behave as if he knew them . ”

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG public prosecutor issued a decision of non - jurisdiction and referred the case to ORG . ORG appointed PERSON as inspector for the investigation of the applicant ’s allegations that his brother had been taken into detention by the gendarmerie captain PERSON and ORG under the guidance of the temporary village guard PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG issued a decision of non - prosecution , finding that there was insufficient evidence to take proceedings against PERSON , PERSON or PERSON .
CARDINAL . PERSON has been included in the list of persons who are being searched for by the gendarmerie in the entire territory of GPE , and the search for him continues .

CARDINAL . The person who was apprehended and shown during a television news broadcast in DATE was not the applicant ’s brother . Several persons being held in detention have the same name as the applicant ’s brother . However , their dates and places of birth and particulars are different from those of the applicant ’s brother .
CARDINAL . By a letter of CARDINAL DATE the Deputy Permanent Representative of GPE to ORG informed the ORG as follows :
“ ... I have the pleasure to enclose herewith the text of a declaration which the Government would be willing to make unilaterally with a view to resolving the ... application .
The Government kindly requests the ORG to decide that it is no longer justified to continue the examination of the application and to strike the case out of the list under LAW . ”
The relevant parts of the appended declaration read as follows :
“ I declare that the Government of the Republic of GPE offer to pay ex gratia to the applicant , Mr PERSON , the amount of QUANTITY [ in respect of ] the application registered under no . CARDINAL .

This sum , which covers any pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage as well as costs , shall be paid in pounds sterling , free of any taxes that may be applicable and to an account named by the applicant . The sum shall be payable within DATE from the date of delivery of the judgment by the ORG ... This payment will constitute the final resolution of the case .

The Government regret the occurrence of the actions which have led to the bringing of the present application , in particular the disappearance of the applicant ’s brother PERSON PERSON and the anguish caused to his family .

It is accepted that unrecorded deprivations of liberty and insufficient investigations into allegations of disappearance constitute violations of ORG , DATE and CARDINAL of the Convention . The Government undertake to issue appropriate instructions and adopt all necessary measures with a view to ensuring that all deprivations of liberty are fully and accurately recorded by the authorities and that effective investigations into alleged disappearances are carried out in accordance with their obligations under the Convention .

The Government consider that the supervision by ORG judgments concerning GPE in this and similar cases is an appropriate mechanism for ensuring that improvements will be made in this context . To this end , necessary cooperation in this process will continue to take place . ... ”
